_prev_prog_3.EquipmentTested: Reactor and Storage Tank. Visual inspection only, before operating reactor

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
ACCIDENTAL RELEASE PREVENTION POLICIES
The Buttonwillow Warehouse Company has a long standing commitment to worker and public safety. This commitment is demonstrated by the resources invested in accident prevention, such as personnel training and consideration of safety in the design, operation, and maintenance of the anhydrous ammonia system.  The Buttonwillow Warehouse Company's policy is to implement reasonable controls to prevent foreseeable releases of regulated substance.

STATIONARY SOURCE AND REGULATED SUBSTANCE
The Buttonwillow Warehouse Company - Site 1700 facility maintains and operates a process system comprised of anhydrous ammonia, as well as ammonium polyphosphate production.  The covered process is the equipment and piping associated with the Anhydrous Ammonia Storage, Transfer and Reactor Station located at 715 Yoder Blvd, Corcoran, CA.  The regulated substance is anhydrous ammonia. 

The maximum intended inventory of anhydrous ammonia for this facility is approximately 108,768 pounds.  The anhydrous ammonia is stored in the ammonia storage tank and also in the ammonia bobtail trailers.

HAZARD ASSESSMENT SUMMARY/OFFSITE CONSEQUENCE ANALYSIS

Worst-Case Release Scenario Results Summary
Scenario Description: Per the RMP Regulations, one worst-case release scenario has been defined for the anhydrous ammonia system.  The results can be found in the Hazard Assessment documentation.  

Alternative Release Scenario Results Summary
Scenario Description: Per the RMP Regulations, one alternative-case release scenario has been defined for the anhydrous ammonia system.  The results can be found in the Hazard Assessment documentation.  

Risk Considerations
Although the storage and use of anhydrous ammonia has inherent potential risks and the release scenarios can potentially reach sensitive populations within the community, the Buttonwillow Warehouse Company has recognized these potential risks and structured its safety programs to make the wo

rst case type of event non-credible.  In addition to the safety practices of the facility and plant personnel to make the worst-case event non-credible, it should also be recognized that there are inherent analysis assumptions that make the results of the atmospheric dispersion analysis appear worse than what would actually be expected during such an event.
In addition to the use of conservative analysis assumptions that over-predict the effects of a potential release, other characteristics of the facility and site serve to minimize the potential risks associated with an anhydrous ammonia release.  The facility has excess flow valves, pressure relief valves, adequate personal protective equipment and shower sources, and trained personnel.  

ACCIDENTAL RELEASE PREVENTION PROGRAM
As part of the implementation of RMP Program 3, key Prevention Program elements were documented and implemented by the Buttonwillow Warehouse Company to manage process safety issues associated with the use of anhydrous ammonia. Prevention Program 3 elements include:

Process Safety Information (PSI) 
Process Hazard Analysis (PHA)
Operating Procedures (OP)
Training (TRN)
Mechanical Integrity (MI)
Management of Change (MOC)
Pre-Startup Review (PSSR)
Compliance Audits (CA)
Incident Investigation (II)
Employee Participation (EP)
Hot Work Permit (HWP)
Contractors (CON)
Emergency Planning & Response (EP&R)

FIVE-YEAR ACCIDENT HISTORY
There have been no RMP-applicable releases of anhydrous ammonia at the facility in at least the past five (5) years.  

FLAMMABLES: WORST CASE
The use of flammable materials at the Buttonwillow Warehouse Company- Corcoran Yard is not encompassed by either the federal or state RMP requirements.  Therefore, this section is not applicable. 

FLAMMABLES: ALTERNATIVE RELEASE
The use of flammable materials at the Buttonwillow Warehouse Company - Corcoran Yard is not encompassed by either the federal or state RMP requirements.  Therefore, this sect

ion is not applicable.

EMERGENCY RESPONSE PROGRAM 
The Buttonwillow Warehouse Company is not a first responder.  Thus, Buttonwillow Warehouse Company has and Emergency Action Plan in place and submits appropriate documentation to the applicable agencies in regards to chemicals and associated quantities as to be included in the community emergency response plan.

PLANNED CHANGES TO IMPROVE SAFETY
Buttonwillow Warehouse Company is extremely diligent in the handling of anhydrous ammonia. Planned changes to improve safety are listed as recommendations in the PHA Report.  A recommendation tracking log has been developed to ensure they are addressed and closed out in a timely manner.
